DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate if a physical activity counseling program during pulmonary rehabilitation increases the physical activity level in daily life in patients with Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease.
DOC.criteria: confirmed COPD (GOLD stages BD) according to GOLDguidelines Mental or physical disability (minimental score <20) precluding informed consent or compliance with the protocol morphine medication Primary diagnosis of heart failure Uncontrolled arrhythmias causing symptoms or hemodynamic compromise Severe comorbidity (acute coronary syndrome, unstable angina terminal renal failure, concomitant pulmonary embolism, very severe pneumonia: CURB65>3) Severe untreated arterial hypertension at rest (> 200 mm Hg systolic, > 120 mm Hg diastolic)
